title: The Phantom Carriage (1921)

So says the legend that drives The Phantom Carriage (KÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶rkarlen), directed by the father of Swedish cinema, Victor SjÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶strÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶m. The story, based on a novel by Nobel Prize winner Selma LagerlÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶f, concerns an alcoholic, abusive neÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢er-do-well (SjÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶strÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶m himself) who is shown the error of his ways, and the pure-of-heart Salvation Army sister who believes in his redemption.
